pr_title: Add more values to coap-adapter configuration.

timeline.bodyText:
There is no need for the @value tag here as this is already the place where it is defined.
Using the @value tag makes sense in JavaDoc comments of other methods where you would like to refer to the value of the constant instead of the definition (as you already do below) ...
timeline.author: sophokles73

timeline.bodyText: are these values supposed to be per processor core?
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: I don't think I can follow. Does this mean that the same value is supposed to be the right one for a VM with 1 (virtual) core and also for a VM with 64 cores?
replies.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: Yes, because of the current PSK limitation ;-(.
replies.author: boaks

replies.bodyText: And, if you have 64 cores, just configure a larger value.
replies.author: boaks

replies.bodyText: So this value is indeed per core, right? If I have one core, 32 is a good value. If I have two cores, 64 is a good value? Or is there a certain minimum number of threads that we want to have?
replies.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: Currently I see this configuration value more as possibility to try out, what fits best. The actual default value is no based on too much experience.
replies.author: boaks

timeline.message:
Add more values to coap-adapter configuration.

dtls threads: improve handshake processing
dtls retransmission timeout: support constraint embedded devices.
exchange lifetime: reduce heap consumption
message offloading: reduce heap consumption

Signed-off-by: Achim Kraus <achim.kraus@bosch.io>
